abstract: Companies with less-than-sterling credit are rushing to sell bonds and take advantage of low interest rates.
snippet: Companies with less-than-sterling credit are rushing to sell bonds and take advantage of low interest rates.
lead_paragraph: Jim Casey remembers the fast times when Michael R. Milken ruled Wall Street as the billionaire king of junk bonds, Nelson D. Schwartz writes in The New York Times.

headline.main: Junk Bonds Are Back on Top
